phoenix

Class weather

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoenix.weather

  • public final class weather
extends java.lang.Object
    API Generated: Tue May 17 06:47:42 EDT 2016
    API Source: WeatherAPI
    WeatherAPI provides access to weather information, including current forecast and long range forecasts.

      • weather

        public weather()

    • Method Detail

      • Update

        public static boolean Update()
        Forces the current and forecasted weather to update. It is up to the implementation to ensure that weather updates are cached. If the weather is updated since the last call then it will return true. If an Error happens, then IsError will return true and GetError will contain the failure message.
        Returns:
        true if the weather was updated

      • SetLocation

        public static boolean SetLocation(java.lang.String postalOrZip)
        Sets the user's location as a Postal Code or Zip Code. If an implementation doesn't natively use this information, it should try to convert the location into something can be consumed by the implementation. For example, the Yahoo Weather Service doesn't use zip code so it will convert it into the Yahoo WOEID. If the implemenation can't convert the postal or zip code, then this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        postalOrZip - ZIP or Postal Code
        Returns:
        true if the implementation accepted the zip code.

      • GetLocation

        public static java.lang.String GetLocation()
        Get the current weather location's ZIP or Postal Code. It may return null, if the weather hasn't been configured.
        Returns:

      • SetUnits

        public static void SetUnits(java.lang.String units)
        Set the Unit for the weather service. Valid values are 'm' for Metric, and 's' for Standard (imperial) units.
        Parameters:
        units -

      • GetUnits

        public static java.lang.String GetUnits()
        Return the configured units for the Weather Service
        Returns:

      • GetCurrentWeather

        public static IWeatherData GetCurrentWeather()
        Returns the current weather information. You should call update() before calling this method since this will not force an update automatically.
        Returns:
        IWeatherData instance for the current weather conditions

      • GetForecast

        public static java.util.List<IWeatherData> GetForecast()
        Returns the long range forecast. Depending on the implementation is may include today's weather.
        Returns:
        List of IWeatherData instances for each day, ordered by day.

      • IsConfigured

        public static boolean IsConfigured()
        Return true if the Weather Service is configured.
        Returns:
        true if configured

      • GetForecastDays

        public static int GetForecastDays()
        Returns the number of days in the weather forecast
        Returns:
        days in the forecast

      • GetLastUpdated

        public static java.util.Date GetLastUpdated()
        Returns the Date the weather was last updated.
        Returns:
        Date of last update

      • GetLocationName

        public static java.lang.String GetLocationName()
        Returns the location name (usually the City) if known. This may be null until an update happens.
        Returns:
        location name, usually the city

      • HasError

        public static boolean HasError()
        Return true if there was a Weather Service error
        Returns:
        true if error

      • GetError

        public static java.lang.String GetError()
        Returns the error if HasError return true, otherwise it will return null.
        Returns:

      • GetDate

        public static java.util.Date GetDate(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Returns the Date for the given weather condition
        Returns:

      • GetLow

        public static java.lang.String GetLow(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Returns the formatted Low Temperature for the forecasted weather.
        Returns:
        low temp

      • GetHigh

        public static java.lang.String GetHigh(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Returns the formatted High Temperature for the forecasted weather.

      • GetTemp

        public static java.lang.String GetTemp(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Returns the current formatted temperature.
        Returns:
        current temp

      • GetText

        public static java.lang.String GetText(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Returns a descriptive text for the current weather condition. It will be something like, "Mostly Cloudy", or "Partly Sunny"
        Returns:
        textual description of the current weather condition.

      • GetCode

        public static java.lang.String GetCode(IWeatherData iweatherdata)
        Return the weather condition code, as described in http://developer.yahoo.com/weather/#codes 

         0      tornado
 1      tropical storm
 2      hurricane
 3      severe thunderstorms
 4      thunderstorms
 5      mixed rain and snow
 6      mixed rain and sleet
 7      mixed snow and sleet
 8      freezing drizzle
 9      drizzle
 10     freezing rain
 11     showers
 12     showers
 13     snow flurries
 14     light snow showers
 15     blowing snow
 16     snow
 17     hail
 18     sleet
 19     dust
 20     foggy
 21     haze
 22     smoky
 23     blustery
 24     windy
 25     cold
 26     cloudy
 27     mostly cloudy (night)
 28     mostly cloudy (day)
 29     partly cloudy (night)
 30     partly cloudy (day)
 31     clear (night)
 32     sunny
 33     fair (night)
 34     fair (day)
 35     mixed rain and hail
 36     hot
 37     isolated thunderstorms
 38     scattered thunderstorms
 39     scattered thunderstorms
 40     scattered showers
 41     heavy snow
 42     scattered snow showers
 43     heavy snow
 44     partly cloudy
 45     thundershowers
 46     snow showers
 47     isolated thundershowers
 3200   not available

        Implementations should map their condition codes to the codes listed

        Returns:

        public static java.lang.String GetSunrise(IWeatherData iweatherdata)

        time of sunrise
